name: Joli Cobb
text: Great wine, tapas, and desserts downtown and they sell retail wine at great prices. Live music on the weekend. They also have a lounge area that has comfy chairs and couches. Highly recommend!

name: Susan Marie Wenner
text: Looks closed, surprised it was open. What fun it was. Great bourbon specials!

name: Donovan Butler
text: Jesse and Joli will take great care of you. My favorite bar downtown. Great wine selection and cool atmosphere.

name: Paula Coleman
text: "Professional Staff! Atmosphere is so inviting! Casual but very Upscale! Absolute Delicious! All the food is bursting with flavor! A must....visit there facilities for lunch, cost is very reasonable for the large portion sizes. Everything is so tasty! Love, Love Love the crab toast and the brussel sprouts!" The management staff(Nicki and Rosco) is very warm! Also, check there bar out...(great staff and fun). The drinks are the BOMB and REAL Italian wine!

name: Pete Welch
text: Great meal. Quick and attentive service. Really nice and warm feel to the decor. The oysters with granita were something unique I had not had before and would definitely have again. Buckwheat crepe with pork belly was interesting and delicious. The scallops dish was beautiful and excellent.

name: Art Hogarth
text: The staff are great and very friendly!  the food was flavorful and well presented.  i have not had a bad meal here.  Check them out and enjoy the food!

name: Steve and Deana Chapman
text: Excellent atmosphere. Casual, yet upscale. The crab toast is delicious and ample to share as a starter. The duck breast was tender and juicy. The watermelon granita with fennel cookie was the perfect ending to a great meal. Reasonably priced for exceptional food.

name: Brent Cary
text: Great menu with unique items.  I asked the server to bring me her favorite item and it was one of the best ribeye steaks I have had.  The flavors were phenomenal. Great place to eat in Birmingham.

name: Anthony Staggs
text: My wife and I came to Pizitz on a whim and... WOW, we were blown away! Fero is where it's at on every level; the atmosphere, the staff, the food and drinks were completely above what we expected. We definitely recommend to any and everyone, especially couples looking for a laid back upscale experience

name: Edward DeMellier
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. We did have a couple of disappointments however. First, the oysters served with a horseradish granita was almost tasteless (they didn't charge us for the oysters after they asked how we liked them and we told the truth). After the meal was over we asked why we don't served bread, the answer was that they do if we had only asked. Otherwise our entrees were delicious and we will be back and be sure to ask for bread.

name: cam johnson
text: Ribeye was unbelievably good.  Lamb ravioli with ricotta rocked, our app was good too.  Service was good. Looking forward to returning.

name: Matthew Smith
text: Delicious... Had my birthday dinner here. Service was excellent and knowledgeable. Food was incredible (still dreaming of the Pork Osso Buco), cocktails were well done, and dessert was incredibly rich and chocolatey.

name: Ashley Teague
text: The food is outstanding and the only thing that could possibly be better than that is the incredible service. I love this place!

name: J C
text: Over salted and unimpressed.  I came in expecting something to challenge other Italian/Mediterranean restaurants in town, but came away unimpressed.  The bolognese was way over salted and nothing special, and the wine was overpriced and not unique.  I like Italian reds and the Caparzo Rosso is not unique or great.  I wanted to like this place, but I believe there are better options for similar prices.

name: Julie Sullivan
text: Stellar food in a modern setting. Pasta dishes are amazing. I loved the duck ragout and the braised lamb. My ribeye was cooked to perfection with gnocci and chantrell mushrooms. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

name: Greg Randall
text: Staff was knowledgeable & friendly, space was hip and had just the right level of noise, and the food was excellent -- well cooked/seasoned/considered.

name: Tena Diliberto
text: Delicious food and great service. We had a great meal!

name: Graham Hixon
text: Awesome adventurous Italian with fantastic staff. Never fails.

name: Todd Brownstein
text: I live in Bhm and a "foodie" friend was visiting from out of town on Sunday evening and looking for great meal to reconnect over! Unfortunately, theres a great gulf of fine dining on Sunday or Monday in the city. She was staying at the Elyton Hotel one block away (FABULOUS!) so we walked to the Patzits Food hall and THANKFULLY "Fero" keeps longer hours than the other stalls in the main hall. It was a fantastic experience from entrance to exit. The staff is welcoming and informed, and one of the owners "Charles" greeted us and watched over our two hour feast with (non-intrusive) zeal like a true restraunteur...both he and the food were delightful. The oysters with frozen granita were unexpected and divine, and her chicken with fall veggies and my scallops with an Egyptian spice sear were flawless! Even the coffee and and mascarpone beignets were exemplary. It was a grand meal in modernist restrained surroundings..exactly what we were seeking! !Bravo! "Fero" and welcome to Bhm! I'll be recommending your restaurant to everyone!

name: G. Everett Reeves
text: Amazing place with amazing food, staff, & service.

name: Timothy Gawne
text: Very good food and a nice atmosphere, but I'm not going back.  OK this seems minor, and I know that restaurants make a lot of money on wine, if I want a bargain on wine I'll go to Costco, but when you take a date to a nice restaurant, and the waitress goes over the top pushing the most expensive bottle, says only bad things about the other ones, so that if you take a more moderately priced bottle you look cheap, well, I won't say anything at the time but I won't go back.  And there was no chiller, so my very expensive Chardonnay ended up lukewarm.  And no bread.

name: Brandi Johnson
text: Great food and atmosphere

name: Cooper Crippen
text: Very good food but can get expensive quickly

name: Isabel Marques
text: Great wine and amazing food!

name: Chris Clark
text: Had a tasty brunch and Bloody Mary!

name: Wolfie Tv
text: Place is LARGE. Bigger than you think when u first walk in. At first you are greeted with a glass box filled with a plethora of different CIGARS. If your not sure of what CIGAR MOOD your in the host is happy to give recommendations. He RECOMMENDED me with Churchill’s last hour cigar after giving me a brief history lesson. His recommendation was right on the MONEY. If you choose to stick around a enjoy your cigar, behind the glass wonder box of cigar is a SPACIOUS LOUNGE where you and friends enjoy a pleasant even

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Jason Walsh
text: Had a really fun experience here, I learned about cigars, and Alabama. Bottom line was that the staff AND the patrons were all super friendly.  Feeling welcome at a place when you're from out of town is great. If your like cigars and bourbon stop by and find out for yourself!

name: Rebecca Dye
text:
Visited for the first time today, and loved it! Bigfoot was super helpful and gave my husband some sound advice on what to try. I explored the lounge in the back, which was quite handsome.

The entire store is masculine, sophisticated, and quite relaxing. It was pristinely clean, including the restrooms. I highly recommend coming in to shop and to spend some time.

We will be back, sooner rather than later.

resp.text: Thanks Rebecca!

name: Mike Williams
text: It is simply the best cigar lounge in the city.....

name: Melvin Ramsey
text: Real nice with their selections.

name: Amanda Atchenson
text: Very nice place. Good prices and a great variety of cigars. Very friendly staff also. The Arturo fuente double chateau is one of my favorites. It's a really good cigar if you prefer a milder cigar. The Arturo fuente king b is a great one also, it's a little stronger but not too bad.

name: LaShandra Hatcher
text: Staff is wonderful and the place is calm and welcoming. They have the best selection in town. Great place to unwind without drama unlike another establishment in town. Great location and close to everything Downtown!

resp.text: Thanks!!

name: Oscar Rodriguez
text: A very nice place with excellent Cigar Selection and amazing customer service 😀!

resp.text: Thanks Oscar!

name: Marvin Wells
text: Perfection.

name: Paul Calhoun
text: What a fantastic place and a breath of fresh air.  The staff is knowledgeable but never pushy f,but never overbearing.  Smoking areas outside, upstairs, and downstairs with televisions everywhere. It's a great place to grab a cigar and watch a game.  A+ highly recommended.

name: Ted Danson
text: Wonderful place to enjoy a cigar or smoke my pipe.  They are friendly and helpful but not pushy.  Other places in town can't compare when it comes to the personnel vitola has brought in.  Top notch cigar selection with lots of seating areas.  Must try when in Tuscaloosa!!!!

name: Greg Wood
text: Had a good experience with John today around 12:30. I had a variety of needs. Pipe, torch, etc... he was very kind and patient with me and got set up real nice!!

name: Conrad Voyles
text: Love this place. Parking sucks though. Best cigar selection in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thanks Conrad!

name: Donkor Hardie
text: Hung out to watch the national championship and had a great time with Dr.Drew. Great location, even better cigars and service.

name: kimberly Hall
text: Great, laid back, clean atmosphere. We will definitely be back👍👌

resp.text: Thanks Kimberly!!

name: Michael Holmes
text: Great atmosphere. Great cigars. Great service. Jeff was great. All around... great

resp.text: Thanks Michael!

name: David Clark
text: Good place to meet your friends for a herf. BF and Ron are great employees. Prices are good.

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Pat Donovan
text: Very relaxed atmosphere with full bar and killer humidor.

resp.text: Thanks Pat!

name: Arash Soltani-Tehrani
text: A very nice cozy place to smoke cigar with caring staff

name: Ambrose Wiering
text: Nice selection, prices are normal. Place looks great.

name: Baba Yaga
text: Beautiful humidor, and nice selection of cigars. They are finally serving a few types of alcohol. Which coupled with the recent friendlyness of the staff, makes thier rating go up. The smoke eaters are way too loud, they have good music playing but is still drowned out by the excessive amount of smoke eaters and it makes it harder to converse with a buddy. Cant really hear the games being played either. Up stairs tv has no sound and it was dirty, ashes all over ground, bottles everywhere, full ashtrays- this was before 12pm. Only had 1 guy working so this could be atributed to that. But other times it wasnt as bad but not like other places. All the seating is rediculously uncomfortable-hard leather and metal stools- imo not fit for a lounge, more of a come and go place. Hard to find parking which is a deterrent sometimes. Has potential to be a cool place, but they are not there yet

resp.text:
Baba,
Thanks for the feedback!

name: Nick Crim
text: They have a beautiful selection of cigars while the staff was very helpful. They have my business from now on!

resp.text: Thanks Nick!

name: J P
text: Great selection, great atmosphere, very responsive owners and sales people

name: tommy indeed1955@gmail.com
text: One of the best spot in Tuscaloosa

resp.text: Thanks Tommy!!

name: Demetria Franklin
text: They the cigar shop in town

resp.text: Thanks Demetria!

name: Sand “沙子”
text: Best in town

name: Emma Pann
text: We had a blast at Pinspiration!!!  There are so many projects to choose from.  My hubby and I went on a date for our anniversary.  We loved the splatter room and the bar had great options.  My daughter and I then attended a Mommy, Me, & Muffins event where my daughter got to make a Mother's Day craft.  The staff is amazing!!!  Definitely a great place for a date, girl's night, or to just paint/craft!!

name: Monica Warren
text: Our family had an awesome time celebrating my daughter's birthday. We did the splatter room with the glow paint. The owner and staff provided excellent service. We'll definitely be back to try some of the projects.

name: Allury Arora
text: My family had the most amazing time at the Splatter room. The team here is friendly, personable and offers excellent customer service. They offer multiple choices, we will return to make more memories.

name: Krystal Hand
text: We did our daughter's 10th birthday here and it was great! Everyone had fun in the splatter room and best of all, as the parent, I actually got to enjoy the party as well since they took care of everything! Evan, the owner, was great communicating with me before the party and made sure everything was just as we wanted.  We will definitely go back for more crafting!

name: laurie burton
text: We had the best time today! We did the acrylic pouring and it was amazing. Evan was super helpful and our canvases turned out great. We will definitely be back!

name: tori watkins
text: SOOO FUN.. and endless projects to choose from. Great staff

name: Jamekia Haygood
text: My boyfriend brought me here for Mother’s Day and we had an AMAZING time! The staff was super friendly, helpful and showered us with southern hospitality. It was an overall great experience and we plan to return.

name: Madison Schneider
text: We threw a surprise bridal shower there. The owners were so helpful and hospitable. The experience was fun and our bride enjoyed herself! The drinks were yummy too. We paid $20 to bring in our own food which was a reasonable deal. The splatter room was a fun new experience!

name: CARRIE KNIGHT
text: My daughter and her friend had so much fun in the splatter room. I recommend doing it. Everyone there was very nice!

name: Kyle Conforti
text: Did the splatter room with my girls was a lot of fun will definitely come back

name: Lori Redding
text: Scheduled my daughter’s 13th birthday here. It was amazing!!!  The owner and teacher were super friendly and made sure we had a great time. Loved our string art. Relaxing. And sooo many different crafts to choose from. Highly recommend !

name: Lexii Jackson
text: This review is overdue. I brought my girlfriend here to partake in splatter painting as one of our anniversary activities. The reservation process was quick and effortless on their website. You walk in and have your temp taken, you're given a squirt of sanitizer for your hands and then you sign your waiver if you did not already complete this step online. After completing the waiver a super friendly employee directed us to a table that had been set up with a cute anniversary sign, decorations, chocolate, champagne and our blank canvas. We were then able to add designs with tape that would be peeled off post splatter painting while enjoying our glass of champagne. Once we finished our champagne, part 2 of the fun began. We were taken to the splatter paint room where we put on our protective wear over our clothes, shoe protectors and goggles. While an employee went over the basics, we were given a bluetooth speaker to play music,  they exited, turned off the lights, we blasted our music and the anniversary paint party began! You reserve the room for an hour so you can splatter till you can't splatter anymore. Once finished, one of the owners came in to grab our masterpiece to place on the table to have the tape peeled off and allow it to dry a little. We took off all protective gear, wiped what little paint got on our faces off and decided to sit at their cute bar station to have a couple margaritas and a beer. They have a decent selection of snacks and drinks. The strawberry margaritas were sooooo good. You can easily kill some time while your paint is trying to dry. My girlfriend and I got the pleasure of meeting and speaking to the owners who happen to be husband and wife. They were nothing short of a delight! Wonderful personalities, warm and welcoming. They informed us about their various craft classes that another group was doing. This particular group was making candles and they let us know what a great and fun experience they had. My girlfriend and I will certainly be back to try one of the crafts out. If you're looking for something fun and different,  come here. The owners deserve all of Bham's business! Can't wait to return. Thank you all for such an amazing experience!

name: Jesse Dabbs
text: Very fun, and the owners are really nice. Very good people. Definitely going back for more fun.

name: Brittany McCullough
text: Got to spend my birthday here and it was a PERFECT! We had a fabulous girls night trying out all different crafts. A few of us went into the splatter paint room with glow paint which I highly recommend-- we were able to play our own music too which made it such a fun experience! The staff was super friendly and accommodating and I highly recommend the experience. By the way-- did I mention that they have a beer and wine bar plus snacks?!  Alcohol always makes crafts more fun :))

name: Mindy Ellis
text: My husband and friends surprised me with a 40th birthday party here and it was SO MUCH FUN!!! The staff went all out decorating with cute and creative birthday signs and decor. They had several options for DIY projects set out to choose from....a wonderful variety of choices that catered to a wide variety of people, guys and girls. They were so helpful and patient as we worked on our projects. They also had a wide variety of drinks available. The owners were incredibly friendly and accommodating! It was a wonderful night and a special birthday! Go check them out, you will not be disappointed!!!

name: Abby Hoenstine
text: we had such a blast doing splatter painting for a bachelorette party! evan was super sweet and helpful and we enjoyed our experience so much!

name: Crystal NeVille
text: Great place to allow your creative juices to flow.  The owners are amazing.

name: Natalie
text: Had such an amazing time here! Evan and Melonie were so amazing to my group and we will definitely be back!!!

name: Kinsey Copeland
text: My friend and I went to Pinspiration to do the Splatter room and we had a blast! We got the s’mores and mimosa bucket.. it was delish! The owners of the place were so nice and helpful! Will definitely be doing this again :)

name: Janie Flores
text: Drinks & DIY, need I say more?

name: Ashley Parker
text: Phenomenal Service!

name: Jenny Stephens
text: Really fun birthday party.

name: Holly Ha†cher
text: Great place to just grab a wine and talk to friends and hang out not too loud and offers great food with nice staff!

name: Raya.
text: This is a perfect addition to Downtown Tuscaloosa! The wine selections are great and the small plates are even greater! I got the charcuterie board and the baked Feta. Also the seating is eclectic and modern. You have the option to sit inside or out. I love it.

resp.text: Raya, thank you so much for your review of The Wine Market. We really appreciate your support! We cannot wait to have you back soon!

name: Chelsea Fancher
text: So excited that The Wine Market is finally open! We went in this evening and enjoyed several different glasses of wine, a delicious slice of strawberry cake, and split a charcuterie board with various cheeses and meats. The staff was very kind, especially the manager (Kalynn) who came by to check on each table. She was extremely knowledgeable about their selection and gave great recommendations! I’ll definitely be back soon!

resp.text: Chelsea, thank you so much for your feedback and kind words! We really appreciate it and are so grateful for your support! We cannot wait to see you again soon!

name: Kathryn Drago
text: Lovely seating areas indoors and out. Friendly servers. Terrific wine selection.

name: Victor Jackson
text: I go there, at least, 3 times a week. The staff is very courteous and knowledgable of the products that they are serving. The staff works extremely hard at paying attention to the wants and needs of their customers. The setting is perfect. The atmosphere compliments the products and environment that they are promoting. Perfect place for a date night. Whether, you are waiting to be seated for dinner at a restaurant in the nearby, downtown area; Or, perhaps, you have just finished a dinner and you’re not looking for a place too loud or full of college students this is THE GO TO WINE BAR in Tuscaloosa, AL.

resp.text: Victor, thank you so much for your positive feedback! We are grateful for your support, and are glad you have enjoyed your experiences at The Wine Market! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Wil Bowman
text: Cool spot with an interesting, laid-back atmosphere.

resp.text: Wil, thank you for your positive feedback! We appreciate your support, and hope to see you again soon!

name: Charles Edwards
text: My wife and I have been here 6 times in 2 weeks. We love the rotation of wines, charcuterie boards, and capping the night with a French silk pie. The staff is knowledgeable of their wines, and very attentive in service. Will make it 7 this weekend.

resp.text: Charles, thank you so much for your positive feedback! We are glad you have enjoyed your visits to The Wine Market, and we really appreciate your support! We look forward to having you back soon!

name: dan brown
text: Wine was delicious and the charcuterie board was excellent.

name: Anthony Roberts
text:
First time eating here was tonight. We had two servers for our party of six and they did fantastic. Drinks never got low and the went above and beyond our needs. My steak was cooked to perfection and the sides tasted fresh.

It is more expensive than your average steakhouse, but worth the money.

name: David Barnett
text:
This was a really good dining experience. The best I've had in a very long time.

Not only was the food excellent but the service was unbelievable. There were three waiters serving us and they were all professional, friendly, and helpful. It's hard for me to understand others who have rated the service as anything less than stellar.

My hat is off to the entire staff at Shula's.

name: Steph M
text:
The combination hostess/bartender/waitress was a great server. She went out of her way for me.
I went for spinach salad, so I can't comment on the steak aspect, but the salad was really good and the drinks were delicious.

name: Stacy Giovinco
text: Steak was average and very expensive and i have had better.  The desert we ordered was out of this world.  The service was great as well.  Great atmosphere.  Only giving it two three stars bc of the desert and service. My bill was $250 for a two average steaks.

resp.text: Hi Stacy - Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback, we very much appreciate hearing what our customers think.  We're so glad you enjoyed our high level of customer service, the atmosphere and your dessert!  But we want to make sure you loved your steak as well!  We would love the opportunity to have you back to "wow" you with our Shula Cut steaks.  If you would like, please email me directly at kt@shula.com and we can communicate further.  Thank you!   - Kristen Thompson

name: Anita Frederick
text: My husband and I come and enjoy date night about once a month at Shula's we love the atmosphere at the bar and enjoy getting to interact with the bartender and patrons. Our best experience has been with Lindsey who went out of her way to make sure we had great service and learned more about the cocktails we were interested in trying as well as taking our food order and delivering great customer service. We love our date night and can't say enough good things about Shula's.

name: Anna Goloforo
text: They  need to change their  dress code.  Just because we didn't come from work, with a suit or pant suit they wouldn't serve  us.   Well they list about 200!ir more dollars for dinner.  That's not too wise

name: Andrew King
text: Failed to cook a rare Ribeye...... twice!! Manager and server had an attitude when we showed them the overcooked steak. The second steak they served us was cold. Also ordered the Filet Trio (medium-rare). Two were medium and one was well-done.... J. Alexanders has better service and they know how to cook a rare steak. Cheers!

resp.text: Hi Mr. King.  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your experience. We use feedback like this to identify issues and address them.  Your feedback has been forwarded to our executive team and to our Shula’s team in Birmingham.  We would like to follow-up with you on your experience.  If you are open to it, please email me directly at kt@shula.com with your phone number. Thank you! - Kristen Thompson

name: David Aarons
text: Service great.  Food way overrated.  Ruths Chris and J Alexander's steaks are much better.  Would not go back.

name: respect my privacy
text:
Felt I was prejudiced against because I’m white, and my GF is Mexican. We went to Shula’s on Valentine’s day. I made reservations 5 days before which gave me the options of 3 time slots. I took the earlier time. When I arrived, (5 minutes late and we called to say so) we had to wait an additional 15-20 to have our table which gave me the impression that they were busy. There was nobody in the PLACE and we had to wait! Olive Garden, Outback does this too: They make you wait and the place is only half full! They purposely make it seem as if they are busy when in fact out of 16 tables in the back room, only 3 were occupied. There were 2 black couples and us.
The black female waitress didn’t have “her game on” as she expressed to the couple behind me. For $150.00 + you better have your S—t together!  We ordered different wines and she never identified to us which wines they were. She just placed them in front of us and proceeded to take our order. She incorrectly took our order by not remembering. Did not write it down either. I ordered the 14 oz. rib eye grilled Pittsburg style, med-rare. She returned to our table telling me that they gave me the next size steak for the same price of the 14 oz. because she did not remember the order. We’ll  guess that was OK. When it came it was not P-Burg style. I asked for sour cream for the mashed potatoes and she did not bring that as well. I noticed the lack of friendliness to me and my GF compared to her report w/ the other American-African couples. She just did not care,
When I commented to her about the experience, I tried to do so in a kindly fashion. She never listened to my advice. Her response was “you don’t have to tip me”. Well I still tipped , but only 10% for the service. So in closing, the prejudice I felt, the sub-par alacrity, overly apologetic waitress I’d rather go to Flemmings Steakhouse instead.

name: Robert Woods
text:
So my wife and I go there for our anniversary. May 17th 2013. We make reservations for 6:45PM. The weather was bad that afternoon and it was Friday so we decide to go a little early. We arrived at 6:20PM. We walked in at the same time that two ladies staying at the Wynfrey did. They got to the maître d's desk a split second before we did. They told the maître d' that they did NOT have reservations but could they eat anyway. They were told yes. I was asked if we had reservations. I told them my name. We were told to have a seat, they would be with us soon. The two ladies got seated immediately. We had to wait almost 25 minutes! When we got our food, my baked potato was not done completely.

Point being, there is apparently no benefit to making reservations!!!!!

name: Charnessa Mz. Watch Me Campbell
text: First time here and the young lady walked us all the way to our table to sit down, once we sat down, she tells me I can't wear my bball cap which is plan gray with no writing at all, so we left and came to J. Alexander's. Thanks for a first time bad experience.

name: Andrew McCarrell
text: I've always had outstanding food and service at Shula's.  I typically go for lunch.

name: Shelia Clary
text: We went this afternoon only to find they were  not opening until 4 pm. The website saus daily 11:30 to 9:30.... the gentleman insode was rude and said well the sign outside says we open at late on Sunday.... I will not ever go back.

name: Koopa Wesson (Koopa)
text: The best steak I've ever eatin.!!!!!! Amazing!!!

name: Ashton Parsons
text: Took two hours for food to arrive, 13 people. It was embarrassing, VIP room, no one else was here.

name: Adam Waldrup
text: Amazing steakhouse!!

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and kind words! We're glad that you enjoyed your experience at Shula's, and we hope to have you back again sometime soon!

name: Bryan Benson
text: Wonderful,  as usual!

name: m. Rainer
text: Best restaurant in the area!!!  The service here blows every other restaurant in town away.  Food is outstanding and changes with the local produce.  If you want a great meal and you're willing to pay just a little extra for the service this is the place to be.

name: Jimi Threet
text: I've been to Maestro 2300 a twice now. This place is amazing to say the least. The passion in the food is second to none. The ingredients in the food are fresh, complimentary to one another, and always well prepared. The presentation is like art on a plate. The atmosphere in the restaurant is classy yet warm and inviting. The staff are phenomenal, always eager to serve. A great place to take a date or even the family.

name: Jeffrey Chieppa
text: Had drinks and appetizers with the range and reef. Great music, great service, great food. Drinks were good.

name: Ben Boyd
text: Great food, impressive wine menu, excellent service. Perfect for special occasions or when you just want a fine dining experience.

name: Kevin Ellis
text: excellent food and service,  nice atmosphere, clean and relaxing.  Great place to have dinner

name: auburn phan
text:
Would NEVER recommend this place to anyone in Auburn. Me and my boyfriend got food poisoning from eating here. If you are going to spend that much don't spend that much to throw up and stay in the bathroom. Very disappointed.

Food poisoning occurs when you swallow food that contains bacteria, parasites, viruses, or toxins made by these germs.

- Now that is just gross. Clean it up Maestro 2300.

name: Mohammadnaser Ansari
text: You should try the filet burger. Definitely a top 5 burger in Auburn

name: Linda V. Russo
text: Wonderful menu and wine list, and outstanding service !

name: Timothy Bayles
text: Excellent! To start, the building itself is amazing. The fact that it is also filled with great wine, amazing food, and talented people, takes it to the next level! I am so happy this is in Birmingham!!!

name: Alexandra Battito
text: Gorgeous timeless decor and friendly knowledgeable staff! Fantastic selection of wines by the glass, delicious small plates, and large retail bottle selection. Surprised by their reasonable prices as well. So happy for this addition to 2nd Ave N!

name: Christina Coleman
text: We love this place. Servers are professional and helpful. We enjoyed sitting outside and talking with people as they walked by. Definitely going back.

name: Anita Gann
text: Beautiful interior and ambiance. Sleek and clean, yet warm and welcoming. Simple menu with fresh, seasonal, local products. Staff is knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. Outstanding wine list. Gray and Ashley have provided an elegant place to relax with friends.

resp.text: Thank you Anita!!!

name: Fleming Bails
text: Great selection, super knowledgeable staff. Do not pass on the pickled veg with your charcuterie board, 10/10!!

name: John Bowles
text: Great selection of wonderful wines, delicious charcuterie. Excellent service. Fine balance between bar and table service. (And, they also do retail wine sales.)

resp.text: Thank you so much and we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Roger Carlisle
text:
Wonderful food, ambiance, and wine.
The tarting, salmon and beef cheek sliders
are delicious. The wine is excellent and
fairly priced.  We love the atmosphere.

name: VSW
text: Amazing wine bar. Great ambiance and small plates.

name: jonathan raney
text: Love. Delicious food, excellent pairings. Also great to-go board options. Knowledgeable, friendly staff.

name: Patrick Helmick
text: been wanting to go to Avine since they opened and got there yesterday- what a GREAT addition to the birmingham food /drink family ! First of all the place is beautiful-! The next thing we noticed was the enthusiasm of the staff- but that is  backed up by outstanding knowledge of the wine and food offerings. We put ourselves in their able hands and we were rewarded with delicious wines and small plates to compliment the wine. Overall a great experience ! Go you will be rewarded - we will be back soon and often !

name: Jorge Rodriguez H
text: Best service I had in Birmingham, highly recommend for chill hangout for wine and snacks.

resp.text: Thank you Jorge! Hope you have a chance to visit us again soon. Cheers!

name: courtney callis
text: Posh atmosphere (upbeat / not too stuffy), attentive / friendly service, great wine selection AND cocktails (if you are not a wino). And I love that you can buy bottles to go!

name: Lee Winnige
text: Cool wine bar with small bites downtown. Not a huge wine selection by the glass but always changing and always a good selection. Open any bottle is the shop for a corkage fee.

name: ericthered78
text: Everything about this place outstanding.

name: John Mark Boozer
text: Ditto to everything Alexandra said. This place is the bomb. Go for weird stuff from small growers and discover something new.

name: Xoi
text: We are on vacation and chose this place for a quick light lunch. I am soooo happy we did. The owner and her partner were so friendly and attentive. Even discussed local things to do and entertainment. The food was amazing! I will definitely be coming back when I visit gulf shores again.

name: Richard Hart
text: Wonderful food and great service.  The pizza sub was probably the best I've ever had. All of our food was excellent.  Great bar selection.  The owners are wonderful people. We had great conversations. Definitely worth the visit.

name: Amanda Bartee
text: Love this little sweet beach bar!  We decided to try it out as we were staying at the Islands Winds West Condos and it was just a short walk across the road.  So glad we did!  Italian beef sandwich and the Pizza Sub were AMAZING!  Add a frozen sangria to the meal and it was perfect!  Definitely a must if you are down by the beach in Gulf Shores!  I would recommend this place over any of the bigger known establishments!  I wish the owner well! ❤️

name: Lindsey hotmessexpress
text: Best place in town! Amazing food. Good drinks! Gelato was the best. Owners are so personable and kind. Favorite place we went to on our trip, even over the beach!  Will come here every time we visit gulf shores.

name: Brandon Styles Live
text: Great simple menu and iced coffee. Will be back! Met the owner and her family, very sweet.

resp.text: Thanks so much Brandon and Diamond!! We loved meeting you and you family! See you guys soon!

name: Monica Lowe
text: Great wine, cheese, and atmosphere. Joey and Jordan are the sweetest and hard workers/ owners. Come here and enjoy everything!

name: Flavio Bruzzone
text: Really good food. Friendly and kind service.

name: Jennifer Hudson
text:
My husband and I stopped by “Lauria’s by the Beach”
for a quick date night. Both the service and the food was excellent! It was a nice change from the busy/fast paced side of Gulf Shores, and had a calm, welcoming, more cozy vibe. I would highly recommend and we definitely will be returning whenever we visit Gulf Shores!

name: Jeb Stuart
text: Can't say enough good things about this place. Honest humble proprietors doing a great job of providing fresh food and hospitality for anyone who walks in. Order anything and everything

name: Zac Coleman
text: GREAT spot. Cool story behind it and the owners have lots of passion behind it. Wine and cheese bar but in meantime a bagel and coffee shop! Excited to come back next time in town. Highly recommend. Right off the beach.

name: Jennifer Borage
text: Such a great place just across the street from the beach! The people who worked there were so friendly and seemed to put so much care into the food and the business. We had a blood orange sorbet mimosa, coffee afogado, a bottle of wine and a charcuterie board. Building our own board was fun, and it was so beautiful when it came out. We will definitely go back before our stay ends!

name: Alan Geetings
text:
We stumbled upon this place looking for a fun date spot. Wow!!  Super impressed by the young couple who are living out a dream by owning and running this cute spot. The wine was good, the charcuterie board was great, and the fogatto was amazing.

Try it out. You will love it. Local folks who work hard and care about what they do.

name: Dodge Cowart
text: I got food via Doordash and it was literally one of my favorite place to eat so far. Wonderful fresh sandwich and the tomato soup was sweet and perfect.

name: victoria gilmore
text: This is the cutest little place ever. Jordan was our bartender and was very outgoing. Made the experience great. I wish we would of found this place before our last day in Gulf Shores.

resp.text: Thank you Victoria! We are so excited to have our full bar. Safe travels!

name: Jonathan Smith
text: Extremely nice people. Great food and great prices as well will definitely be back when we visit next!

name: drgitzza
text: Beautiful story, great food, awesome people, intimate experience!

name: Jilly S
text: Love this new little gem! Not many coffee shops are open in the late afternoon, but Lauria’s was! They have a simple, yet fancy menu. We just got iced coffees, but will come back and try the Affogatos and the charcuterie boards!

name: Amanda Dykes
text: I love this place. Everything from Gelato to drinks to sandwiches has been wonderful.

name: KS B
text: Best Gelato, Best Bushwhacker made with Gelato, Best coffee and espresso our family had while in the area.  They also had a great meat and cheese charcuterie board.  We tried Bushwackers at all the main spots and Lauria's was by far the best.  This place is a great value and over the top good quality.  We went multiple times while we were in town and it was consistently good.  By choosing this business you will be supporting a true small family owned business.  They were super nice and made some great local restaurant recommendations which helped us get away from the super tourist traps.  Highly recommended.

name: Mike Gardner
text:
We LOVE this place...and the owner. Good coffee, bagels, service.
You will not be disappointed:-)

resp.text: We love you too! Thank you for stopping in, come and visit us again soon!

name: Angela Discon
text:
We have a place in gulf shores 2 blocks from Lauria's.  We tried the italian sándwich  &
Salmon bagel for lunch along with a blood orange mammosa,  it was delicious! Great little quiet spot!

name: Tony Bowser
text: Wonderful service. Great drinks, extensive cheese and charcuterie menu.

name: Nikki LaCoss
text: Wonderful! Food and drinks are spectacular! Nice quiet place.

name: Danielle herod
text: This is a FABULOUS place!! Love the welcoming environment!! They made us a custom charcuterie tray and my husband and I were blown away!! Best tasting meats and cheeses we’ve had!!!! Couldn’t be happier!!

resp.text: Danielle we really appreciate you and you husband for stopping in and trying our charcuterie boards! Hope you see you both soon! We also have new cheeses every week!

name: Cody Branch
text: This place is great. Super friendly staff, gelato and bushwhacker are both delicious.

resp.text: Thank you so much Cody! We're so glad you enjoyed our famous Gelato Bushwacker! Come and visit us again soon!

name: shelby Martin
text: Such a great atmosphere and food! Loved this place and will be back.

resp.text: Thanks so much for coming in and hanging out with us!

name: Charles Goins
text: Super friendly staff! Ham and cheese bagel was fantastic. Can’t wait to go back and try the wine.

resp.text: Psst... Charles the wine is in. We got Wine! We look forward to seeing you soon.

name: Evan Ritchey
text: Great little spot! Would recommend. Super clean, super friendly, and super good.

resp.text: Super Thanks Evan!! We really appreciate you guys coming in!

name: Alex Kolassa
text: Absolutely delicious food and drink,  in a charming atmosphere,  from excellent staff.

name: London Ward
text: so good!! employees were super friendly and the ham and cheese bagel was the best bagel i've ever eaten. 6/5!!

resp.text: Thank you very much! I'm so glad you enjoyed the food we are building and expanding the menu everyday!

name: Brittany Befus
text: This place is the cutest!! Great atmosphere, employees are always friendly. Also one of the only places in Gulf Shores to hang with friends by the beach with WINE and CHEESE boards!!!

resp.text: Thank MOM!!! You're going to be the best Mom!

name: Robin Befus
text: Lauria’s is such a little gem with Italian themed food and amazing specialty drinks.  Everything I’ve had tastes amazing and fresh and the atmosphere is fun and relaxing.

name: Cinnabon-Jonn
text: Great place to relax and have a drink! Kind and  lively staff! Overall great experience while in town!

resp.text: Thanks buddy! The bar is really building up fast. You'll have to visit soon!

name: Shannon Cummins
text: Fantastic food and drink with amazing service!  Skip The Hangout and come here!

name: Megan Gardiner
text: The service and food are AMAZING! The caprese bagel is absolutely phenomenal!

name: Scott Steger
text: We had no idea this place was within walking distance from our condo, the food was amazing and we will be back!

name: Hernando Gonzalez
text: Great place to have a nice coffee. Amazingly recommended!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much!! We are happy to bring coffee to Beach Blvd and are so glad you enjoyed it!

name: Tomáš Pečinka
text: Great bagels! Best breakfast place in Gulf Shores! Friendly and welcoming!

resp.text: You da best!! Thank you Tomas!

name: Joseph Cieniewicz
text: Awesome new place, great service and drinks. Will definitely be back again!!!

name: Jonathan Befus
text: Great food and convenient location.  Easy to grab and go!

resp.text: Thanks DAD!!!

name: Nate Blake
text: Awesome spot. Great people :)

resp.text: Thanks so much you'll have to stop by again we just added our full bar and the wine is in!!

name: Josh Park
text:
Great people
cool spot
Classy environment
Loved it!

resp.text: Thank so much Josh! Stay Classy!

name: Justin Steger
text: Wow! Great place to hang! So cool!

resp.text: Thank you!! Thank you!!

name: Tina Steger
text: Great place!!! Only steps away from the beach!

name: Noah Befus
text: Great place and great people!

resp.text: Ive got a cold jack and coke waiting for you! Or Johnnie Walker Black Label!!

name: E Smith
text: Awesome food and people!!

resp.text: E. Smith you are the best! Thank you!

name: Matt hood
text: Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!A must check it out!

name: Chris Crow
text: On our way to Orange Beach we decided to stop by here on a Friday afternoon a little after 4 pm. I was looking for a specific wine. Since my Google search indicated this was also a wine tasting business I assumed it would be the best place to stop. It was also a locally owned business and not a chain store and I like to support local businesses when traveling. Unfortunately, the store was closed several hours early. No sign on the door to explain or anything. On the bright side, I found what I needed not very far away in Orange Beach! Skip this spot. Drive a few extra miles to find what you need. I can't recommend a business that doesn't stay open during business hours.

name: Barb
text:
What a wonderful place to get together on Wed night for wine tastings.
The owner is super and will order anything for you if she doesn’t carry it. She is very knowledgeable about all wines.
Once a month is paint and taste wines. Sooo much fun!!!

name: Nikki Shanks
text: Very disappointed. We walked in at 4:12 and looked around at all of the wine a few times. No one came out from the back. Could hear two women in back laughing and talking. We tried to talk loud hoping they would hear and come and help us. They didn't. So I called the business phone number and they didn't answer although we could hear it ring and ring. My husband finally went in the back and he was told in an unfriendly tone that she'd be out in a minutes. We waited a few more minutes but no one ever came out so we left. Very upset and will never go there again.

name: Clayton Singleton
text: Wonderful atmosphere. Very good selection of beer and wine. Wine tasting on Wednesday night's. The wine makers themselves are there sometimes to conduct the tasting.

name: Kylie Million
text: Love it. Owner is great. Employees are great. Wine is great. Go check them out for yourself. You won't be sorry :)

name: Brian Lehmann
text: Good time at the wine tasting. The owner is very personable and everyone enjoys themselves at the gathering.

name: Mark Jenson
text: Great variety of wines and decent selection of beer as well.

name: allyn triemert
text: The people there are very nice,had a good time painting, however the air quality in there is poor, no air conditioning,makes a big difference

name: David Thompson
text: The wine tastings on Wednesday nights are very fun and the craft beer selection even better!

name: Andrea Beard
text: They have a wide variety of small production wines and beer paired with great service and amazing people.

name: Eve McNeil
text: Always a fun and informative time with a variety of wines to sample.

name: Jennifer Deitz
text: I've been by 3 times and the doors are always locked. Is this place still open?

name: David Thompson
text: Awesome boutique wine shop! Check out the Heavyweight wines!

name: chris hummel
text: Only able to taste on Wednesday and by appointment only.

name: Your Punkin
text: Gave a one only because you have too. Went in to buy wine and ham and could never get anyone to come up from the back all they did was cackle and talk.  Ruined my trip into town.

name: Bob Higgins
text: Our favorite place for weekly wine tastings!

name: Roy Washburn
text: Excellent atmosphere within walking distance of town shopping in Mountain Brook.  We were quickly seated and enjoyed the excellent service of Eduardo.  The salads were wonderful and the pizza was cooked perfectly in the brick oven.  Would definitely recommend and will return next opportunity I have when visiting the area.

name: Rick Troyanek
text: Went for lunch with my daughter and had the lunch special; slice of pizza, salad, and soup. Excellent! $9.95 each. Excellent atmosphere and service.

name: debbie ash
text: Great service and awesome atmosphere and unbelievable food!

name: Hasin Gandhakwala
text: My wife and I went on opening night and although the restaurant was packed, the staff made us feel welcome and service was excellent. There were a few hiccups (understandable for 1st day of business); however, the staff definitely did everything in their power to make up for it. If you want fantastic service & true Italian style pizza, this is the place to go. We'll definitely be back!

name: Tim Suggs
text:
My wife and I decided to try this fairly new to Mountain Brook "Italian Kitchen". We were seated at a super small table and we ordered bruschetta as an appetizer, my wife ordered the house meatballs, and I ordered their chicken alfredo spaghetti. When the "Bruschetta" arrived, our table was now "full" with the plate containing the "toast" with tomatoes masquerading as"bruschetta", and our two dining plates.  Normally, bruschetta is served on some type of grilled French, or "specialty" bread. Nope, ours was served on 3 pieces of "toast", cut diagonally, and fresh out of the bread wrapper.  Only the first piece was edible because the reason you don't use fresh bread is because it becomes soggy very quickly which is exactly what happened with the following 5 pieces of "toast". Oh, they tried to help it out by charing the bread pretty good, but it didn't keep the center of each slice from literally folding over and dumping the bruschetta all over the plate, table AND my clothes as I tried to eat it. The overly toasted crusts were best used to dip my wife's meatball sauce while she wasn't looking.

Soon, my chicken alfredo spaghetti arrived, and it looked nice, creamy, no place to put it however on our uselessly small table so I had to give up my dining plate and just eat my remaining bruschetta straight off of the serving platter...  AND...  WAIT A MINUTE... that's not spaghetti, it's penne pasta. We summoned our waiter, and he apologized but said that he was pretty sure that the chicken alfredo was always served over penne pasta. After requesting the menu again, I pointed out the word "spaghetti" in the description of their "Chicken Alfredo Spaghetti" and he quickly disappeared. Soon, a woman, whom did not introduce herself, appears at our table and says "So, you're not a penne kind of guy huh?". I replied, "No, I'm not."  She then tells me that they are "out of spaghetti" and that she'll "get them to make me anything else on the menu". What she's really telling me is WoW, you do know the difference between spaghetti and penne pasta, AND noticed that we just substituted what you ordered with whatever we had...

My wife was about half through with her house meatballs by this time so I told that I was fine and didn't wish to order anything else. And she hopped right up and disappeared as quickly as my appetite had, never to be seen again.  I left slightly ahead of my wife and when our server told me "Hope to see you again soon...", I just replied, "You won't" as I made my way to the street.

I really don't understand how anyone can find this sort of treatment "acceptable". I don't, and they've lost me, my recommendation to my friends and family, coworkers, business customers and clients as a place to get a good meal and have a nice time.

name: jeremy irwin
text: The pizza is killer, everything looks and taste so fresh plus the prices are super low...what more needs to be said!! I will be back!

name: John Paul Rhodes
text: We celebrated a friend's birthday at MidiCi.  The food and service were great!

name: Regina Gargollo
text: We had a great server but they were out of almost everything me and my friends want that night and had some issues with the quality of food we received. We addressed it to the manager but we were just told that they will make sure to get it right next time. Didn’t even try to make something right at that moment. As much as I love Italian food I’m not coming back.

name: Fernanda Félix Schwarzbeck
text:
It was a great experience overall! ... Our server was really fast and attentive (Jordan) and all the staff were really nice. Manager (I assume) greeted us when arrived and also when we left.
Caesar salad was deliciouuuus! And we had the Devils pizza which was really good as well. Place is cozy, loved the indoor tree!
I would definitely go back!

name: Lauren Bailey
text: Ordered 6 pizzas for the table to share amongst 6 people (on the second night open I might add) and they were all so great! So flavorful, great crust...We ate it all. Our server was awesome- she was so kind and attentive. Great aesthetic atmosphere also, can’t wait to come back!

name: David Loveless
text: The meatballs are to die for! Also, got 2 pizza's and 2 salads that were great. The atmosphere is very fun, and I love that you can see the 2 big pizza ovens as they make your pizza! Highly Recommend.

name: David Hutchins
text: Very nice host who I believe was also the restaurant manager. I had "The Devil's" pizza ($13) and it was great. Not as pricey as you would think it to be, considering it's an upscale looking place. Definitely will revisit the next time in the area

name: Cole Harvey
text: Loved this place at first, good pizza, fantastic ovens, staff and seemingly great management/leadership. Not sure what happened, last couple times the restaurant seemed lost. Service and quality dramatically declined.

name: Ldj
text: Nice pizza dough.. but their ingredients are average. Also I personally think ambiance plays an important roll when you enjoy food. Unfortunately workers in this place looks stressed and disorganized.

name: Chelsea Lewis
text: We love this place! We’ve eaten at all the pizzerias in town and this is by far our favorite! Better than pizzeria gm, better than blaze, better than pieology, the list goes on! Great atmosphere, great staff, great food! We will definitely be back!

name: Tyler Phelps
text: I can't remember the last time I received this time of customer service from a restaurant. They went above and beyond to make our work group feel appreciated. Absolutely recommenced this place.

name: Jackie Pierce
text: Great Environment, friendly service and the food is awesome. It’s great having another small restaurant in the Mountain Brook area. I have been there twice since they opened and both times the food was great and the service was friendly! The Pizzas are our favorite!  My husband and I have also had take outs (twice) so I don’t really know what the other reviewer was talking about? Actually we are ordering dinner to go tonight! Thanks for opening up in our neighborhood! WELCOME!

name: Eyal Ron
text:
The server was awesome!
Greek Salad was great but the garlic bread test was an F.
Calzone and pizza were good but nothing too good.  The decor is less inviting and some how cold.

name: J Dub
text: Wonderful tasty pizza and strong commitment to service. Gourmet pizzas are 12" ranging from $12 to $15 but definitely worth it!

name: Cristina Dieni
text: The place is nice and cozy! Pizza was good! I will come back.

name: Dave D.
text: Came by for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. Staff was genuine and accommodating. Food was delicious - Chicken Pesto Calzone was on point. Will be back.

name: Rachael Gregg
text: We had a great experience at Midici. The atmosphere is awesome and the pizza is delicious. We will definitely be back!

name: GKM Equestrian
text: Food is fantastic the service is getting better. Once they are in sync it will be one of my favorite places.

name: Dallas Gregg
text: Great place. Food and atmosphere were awesome. Wait wasn’t too long and the owner was there and extremely helpful.

name: Elizabeth Crooks
text: European style pizza with an abundance of options in an upscale yet family-friendly environment.  A great addition to dining options in Mountain Brook Village.

name: Chad Brewer
text:
FLAVORLESS! Two stars for the solid wait service outside of that I would give it no stars. My pizza was tasteless.....I’ve had boxed pizzas from the freezer with more flavor. My wife had the spaghetti bolognese and it tasted like well it actually had no taste. An absolute joke for food!

Based on the other reviews I have to wonder if  we might have had poorly prepared the food that night, but I doubt I will give it another shot.

name: Latavia Hinkle
text: Love the food service a little slow

name: Wil Johnson
text: Very enjoyable pizza and calzones. Service and price is very good and is very good quality. Owner greeted us at table and was very friendly. Will return.

name: William Blair
text: Party of 5, 5:30 p.m. seating. The tree dropped leaves in my water 1st thing. Meat Board was very mediocre. Two pizzas & two salads. Tried to order a second bottle of wine, never seemed to get there. Asked about the wine ,was told "We're just getting opened". I suppose we're expected to pay for the staff to learn how to run a restaurant on the job? Asked for salt & pepper, I guess it was got forgotten as well. Had people swarming to take dishes, alas not the case with our waitress.  Sat for 20+ minutes after we finished our dinner  waiting to get our tab. Now the good. The Pizza was A++++ build your own is the way to go.  Salad is a waste of money. But the Pizza will get me back to the place. Get rid of the tree. Outside dining, when it cools off will be terrific

name: Liz Davis
text: Delicious calzone and house salad! We enjoyed the atmosphere and our waitress was helpful and attentive.

name: John Palmer
text: I enjoyed the pizza, I’m not a fan you can not call in a pick up order.

name: Heather Taylor
text: The food was delicious, and the lunch special was a great deal! I will be back! 😁

name: Joe Sanders
text: Great pizza and crust. Faster service than I expected.

name: mike Creel
text: Awful service horrible pizza crust was burnt on the outside and not done on the inside if you like expensive horrible pizza this is your place

name: Harrison Adams
text:
I’m in the business so I can honestly say this place is awful. We were being seated and then the hostess stopped as another waitress jumped in at the table to “seat an investor”, there was no apology and a lot of confusion. The next thing out of the hostess’s mouth was “it’s going to be another 45 minutes to an hour”. I don’t care how average the food may be, customers come second at this place and it won’t be open in 5 years.

Won’t be going back.

name: Katie Fortenberry
text: Everything about it is wonderful. Food & atmosphere, great place all around

name: Nancy Sims
text: Great service and good food.  A reservation helped as it had a 45 minute wait time.

name: Terri Goeman
text: The food was good, the service was friendly, and the atmosphere was nice. However, the menus were dirty, and the tables weren’t promptly bussed. They didn’t have any of the coffee products or italian sodas on the menu. I would go back in hopes the shortcomings were due to it just recently opened.

name: mattia guidali
text: I am Italian, I moved here 3 years ago from Milan. I have to admit that MiDici has the best pizza in town, the only one that I can considered somewhat truly Italian. There were some troubles in the kitchen, they forgot to put prosciutto on one pizza, and they put garlic on another one even though I asked them not to. But those mistakes could easily be forgiven by the quality of the food. The Nutella calzone is something that anybody that goes to MiDici needs to try. The only "bad" thing about it was that the waiter corrected me on my Italian pronunciation of the word "calzone" (I found it very funny). Definitely I will come back.

name: angela ferguson
text: Excellent pizza and very good service!

name: Robert Ashurst
text: Service not so good But they just opened. Food is great!

name: Wanda Bedgood
text: Amazing pizza, but thrifty on the toppings. Caesar salad is a must.

name: Shameka Mason
text: Great food an reasonable prices!!

name: Tim Tha Tyrant
text: Best firewood oven pizza I kno of

name: Julie Schneider
text: Everything was delicious!

name: Eduardo Rodriguez
text: Best pizza in bham!

name: Worth Hanson
text: Good pizza

name: Hanna Brown
text: Brandon and Trent were outstanding! They took the time to guide us through their current favorites, what inspired them to start Golden Age, and they fashioned us the most incredible charcuterie board (genuinely, from France to New York, this charcuterie board tops all). Their shelves are lined with harder-to-find, natural, intentional wines, and their quality is the best we’ve found in Alabama. WE WILL RETURN & RECOMMEND!

resp.text: Thank you so much for making the trip to visit us and for the kind words! It was a pleasure meeting you and good luck with WSET, you’ll crush.

name: Kent Still
text: Golden Age is by far the best specialty bottle shop I've seen. We drove hours to Mountain Brook and were not let down. The 50/50 board was amazing, and the wine recommendations were even better. We will definitely be regular customers and will continue to make the drive for the experience.

resp.text: Thanks so much for visiting us! It was our pleasure. Cheers!

name: Amy Stone
text: Golden age is one of my absolute favorite places in Birmingham. Incredible wine selection in lots of price points. The staff is friendly and helpful—the wines they’ve recommended have quickly become favorites. I love that the staff can help you no matter your level of knowledge on wine. I also love that I can place an order online and they’ll bring the wine to my car. It’s a beautiful space with delicious wine and great people.

name: sandra bowman
text: I love golden age! The space is aesthetically so beautiful. The staff is friendly and always sharing knowledge about the wine that I really love. Learning about wine feels overwhelming so I appreciate how they try to educate their customers also.

name: Brad Lugar
text: Okay, been in bham for a long time. This is place is a nice escape and the vibe here is chill. Definitely coming back.

name: Shelley Coskery
text: Best wine selection in town. Perfect for picking up a bottle and taking home or enjoying a date night out. Love their special events, dinner nights and tastings.

name: Kathleen Buccleugh
text:
The selection at Golden Age is amazing. This shop is THE reason I started to branch out and try new varietals. They have an excellent selection of Austrian and German wines. I highly recommend doing an online order for easy and safe pickup. You can even get some of their pantry (Red Mountain Honey 🤤) and merch (stemware, cheese boards) items online.

If you don't know what type of wine you're looking for, they'll help you out in a heartbeat. And be sure to have a cheese/charcuterie platter in the wine garden. With the Clothbound Cheddar, for sure!!

name: Jordan Van Horn
text: Great wine and even better people. Can’t recommend Golden Age enough.

name: Tim Webb
text:
Great selections, attentive staff and great atmosphere. Would be the perfect place with exception of fact they charged us a $20 corkage fee on a $66 bottle of wine. 2 establishments  within 2 miles of Golden Age gladly serve you their wine without a corkage fee and their prices are as good as or better than Golden Age.
I would like to host my weekly wine group here but they would never go For this corkage fee. We can buy a nice bottle of wine for what the corkage fee cost.
They could greatly increase traffic by doing away with the corkage fee!

resp.text:
Hi Tim,
Thank you for your feedback. We are a new business and every review counts. We are unique in the fact that we have an incredible selection of over 700 wines and also a well-designed wine bar with attentive staff and a great atmosphere. We feel that having pricing on-par and often lower than other wine shops in town makes us a great resource to be able to discover new wines. Apologies if we did not explain the corkage fee, that is on us and we have emailed you a more detailed response.

name: George M. Wolfe
text: Excellent and curated selection of mostly imported wines including some very unusual ones.  The owner is very knowledgeable and also has a great selection of cheese and charcuterie.

name: Hannah Lonsdale
text: The wines are interesting, the staff are nice, but OMG the smell of sewage in the outdoor seating area 🤢🤢🤢

resp.text: Hi Hannah, the city had an issue with the sewer lines that has been resolved. Now the only thing sick here are the wines 🤙🏻

name: Alexandra Smith
text: What a beautiful place. Great prices. Friendly faces. Spectacular wine.

name: Connor Coskery
text: Best wine shop you will find!

name: Kaitlin Slattery
text: The BEST wine selection in all of Birmingham. Alan and I have tried about 6 different bottles over the past few months based off staff recommendations and each one was perfect. A personal favorite, the Gaspard Rosé, who’s description is as follows: the taste of sunshine and the color of sunlight through a window after the rain✨I cannot wait to have a moment free of children to experience a date night at their beautiful bar instead of just swinging by to bring a bottle home! Á votre santé 🍷

name: Danyell
text: Friendly staff, great selection.

resp.text: Thank you for coming out! Cheers, Brandon and Trent

name: M Davis
text: This is my favorite spot in Mountain Brook. Truly the most beautiful space and owned by the best people. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Shopping for wine can be overwhelming if you're not an expert, but Golden Age is super accessible. I love that the wines are low intervention + natural and also affordable. Get a glass of wine + charcuterie board with a friend after work or meet your clients for a drink.. it's the perfect place!

name: Kelsey
text: This is a lovely facility. The staff are attentive. They have large selections. I only met a group here and don't drink wine or alcohol really so I cannot provide much insight.

name: Shella Sylla
text: Excellent wine selection. Super knowledgeable & friendly staff!

name: Mia Peterson
text: I had a wonderful first experience at Golden Age! The vibes were great and the atheistic is pleasing. But their staff is where they shine. Alex joyfully answered my 10,000 questions and had great recommendations. I thoroughly enjoyed my time and will be back.

name: Evan Beattie
text: Great staff. Very helpful. Also accommodated our group in ways they didn't need to. Awesome selection of wine. Awesome atmosphere.

name: Mel B
text:
Excellent wine selection for purchase.
After purchasing several bottles, fiancé and I opted to stay for a glass of wine. Bartender wasn’t overly friendly. (He did not introduce himself.) He didn’t offer a customary,” taste,” before pouring and didn’t bother to ask if we were satisfied with our choice.  Although we don’t expect an animated conversation, we did not feel appreciated as customers.
Another, older couple sitting at a nearby table were treated very differently. From their interactions it appeared he knew them. They sampled a few different wines before being given generous pours.
We observed that the charcuterie board portions were rather small for the price so we passed on the food.
May go back to buy bottles of wine but unfortunately will not be staying to drink or dine.

resp.text:
Hi Mel,
I'm really glad you loved the wine selection! We look forward to seeing you back in the shop soon. I realize that you felt overlooked while spending time with us and we apologize for that. We appreciate your feedback and as a new business we are always looking for ways to provide excellent service.

name: Jim Davis
text: Thoughtful organic wine selection is just the beginning of the vision for this elegant gem. Thanks for the wonderful service we received on our recent visit.  We will be back!

name: Jimmy Truong
text:
Words can’t begin to describe how much I love Golden Age. From the design to the service, they knock it out of the park each time.

The space is a clean and minimal with a huge emphasis on the bar and of course, their huge selection of wine. The bartenders are extremely knowledgeable and insanely hospitable. And if you’re looking for some wine to-go, they have something for everyone at every price point.
That’s another thing I want to talk about. Their prices are more than fair and incredibly approachable. Having traveled to many wine bars from all over the country, this place is the best. Whether you’re searching for a simple wine or trying to venture out to try a funky wine, this place is a can’t miss.

name: Trey Miller
text: Cool place. Good wine. But there is a $20 cork fee when you buy their wine to drink at their restaurant. Just be aware. It was a strange surprise to us

resp.text: Hey Trey! Thanks for coming in and taking time to leave a review. All of our retail wine is priced at retail prices, not restaurant prices. If you buy a bottle at a restaurant it is about 3x the price you pay at our place even with the corkage. Apologies if that wasn’t made clear to you by one of our staff. We would love to have you in again sometime. Cheers, Brandon

name: Robert Williams
text: The best wine bar I have ever been to, across 50 states.  Amazing.  And the owners are knowledgeable and very friendly.  Wines are the best I've ever tasted.

resp.text: Cheers! Great meeting you!

name: Perry Riddle
text: Excellent wine bar and retail shop specializing in natural wines. Golden Age has filled a void in Birmingham. The owners are great guys and very knowledgeable, and the staff is super friendly and helpful.

name: Katie Herron
text: One of a kind atmosphere, incredible selections you can’t get anywhere else, and the staff is very knowledgeable. 5 stars all the way!

name: Genece Bonner
text: The owners are great and very knowledgeable. Great experience.

name: Richard Haberstroh
text: By the glass or bottle. Hands down the best place to pick out a bottle of wine for home and know you will enjoy it! Life is too short for bad wine!

resp.text: Thanks Richard! We are so grateful to be your wine shop!

name: Nathan English
text: Great wine shop and bar. The owner's are nice and knowledgeable. The prices seem very reasonable.

resp.text: Thanks Nathan! We appreciate your business. Our prices are straight retail- the same or even cheaper as some of the grocery stores in town.

name: Craig Stilley
text: Purchasing wine can oftentimes be a frustrating, confusing, and expensive venture. I find myself staring in the wine aisle for 30 minutes reading reviews attempting to make a perfect choice. Brandon and Trent, and the rest of the staff at Golden Age, easily bring things to the ground level for those of us who lack in our wine proficiency. They never upsell you unless it fits what you are looking for. The space is beautifully designed, the service is excellent, and seriously the best prices for the best selection of wine you can find in town. So if you want to buy wine as gift and know nothing about wine, or if you want nerd out with some passionate people about an amazing Grenache, or just grab a couple glasses with your babe and enjoy some charcuterie, THIS IS YOUR SPOT!

name: Kyle Carpenter
text: Great knowledgeable staff! Birmingham’s best place for natural wines!

name: Xanna Griffin
text: Friends joke that if I am not at home or work, I must be at Golden Age. Love the selection, staff, design, and their tasting events. Support your neighborhood wine shop!

name: Craig Brewton
text: Owners are very amenable. A little pricey....but it is in MB.

name: Shaun Osborne
text: The prices are well in line with the likes of Starbucks, etc. The location is excellent and we enjoyed the visit. To be fair, it wasn't a busy time when we went and the people were extremely nice. I had my mother and wife with me and was very interested in getting nice people, even if they couldn't make coffee. All in all, we had a great time and the coffees were great. They were very inviting and homey.

name: Thomas Garner
text: Amazing cappuccino with foam, My friend loves the iced chai tea. Plenty of food options as well. If you visit go upstairs because there are several rooms even one with windows with a view of downtown and the courthouse. If you're lucky you can use the bluetooth speaker and play your own tunes(just don't get caught lol).

name: Kaleb Thurman
text: Our weekly home away from home.  Very enjoyable beverages and menu items.  Inviting atmosphere.  Sit long enough and sip enough beverages and you never know who you will run into.  Wonderful place to just enjoy the company of others.

name: Sarah Jordan
text: One of my favorite coffee bistros in Huntsville.  Local flavor, local art and unique decor. I love the friendliness of the staff.  Highly recommended! Make sure you check out the rooms upstairs. Tons of seating.

name: Anna Parker
text: I've gone in this place 3 different times and 3 different times I've left without anything. The service is awful.  I've gone in waited 10 min without seeing anyone there working to take a. Order. Went in tonight and 2 workers were in the back prepping food while me and another customer waited 5 minutes for someone to take her order.  I eventually left because of how slow they were to even acknowledge us. I don't know how this place stays open. I'm hoping a decent coffee shop will open at the downtown square because Huntsville can use one

resp.text:
Anna,

This is from Cathy. one of the owners of A Cup Of Everything.

Thank you so much for letting us know about this. I will be discussing this with our managers. We work hard to offer great customer service and apologize for for your experience..

Cathy

name: Max Parks
text: Didn't try the coffee, but the pastries were top notch, as was the service. You can go into the cosy rooms upstairs and stay for hours; I went to find a quiet place to do some writing, and felt welcome every time. Absolutely delightful. 5/5

name: Justin Bzdell
text: I go to A Cup of Everything at least once a week. I just love there freshly brewed coffee. The WiFi is  excellent for studying on some school work. I highly suggest the coffee!

name: Zachary Garcia (zakzackzachary)
text: Only store open downtown on 4th of July and the staff was super friendly. 3* from me because the smoothie which was essentially syrup and blended ice was like a cup of tasteless foam and was almost $6. Maybe their other stuff is better though, I can't speak to it.

resp.text: Zachary, we hate to hear that your smoothie wasn't good. Can we make you another to hopefully redeem ourselves?

name: Sally Wise
text: We come here regularly - terrific crafted coffee and tea beverages, plus local craft beer! Great snacks, locally made gifts, and more. Friendly service. Check out the art gallery upstairs, and there is free wi fi

name: Jacque Brandon
text: Not sure which owner the previous ratee met I found both owners to be friendly and gracious.   The food was excellent and the coffee some of the best I've ever had. A cute little bistro enviroment relaxing and very welcoming.

name: Lucas
text: Expensive coffee with mediocre service. I paid almost five bucks for a small  black coffee and a shot of espresso. I've been there a few times, only really if I have to use the bathroom downtown early in the day. Never heard them once say "welcome to cup of everything", or "thanks for stopping by sir!". Just seems like the staff is generally upset to be there.

resp.text:
Mr. LukiPooki

I am one of the owners of A Cup of Everything. I am very sorry you hear that you have has such poor service at ACoE. Please know that we appreciate yours and all our customer's business. If you like I eill be happy to meet you at the shop and I will personally refund you your money.

Regards
Cathy Lamberth
Clamberth@acupofeverything.com

name: Nicholas Thompson
text: It seems as though as this establishment cares more for speedy service rather than quality. The atmosphere is lackluster and the employees seem very disinterested in providing a quality experience that one would expect of a privately owned coffee shop.

name: Stormii L
text: Nice. Love to go sit upstairs on my lunch break.

name: Katheryn Young
text:
A Cup of Everything Convenience Store is truly convenient--a menu loaded with coffees, teas, and sandwiches primarily; and a medium-sized cache of snack bars, bottled and canned drinks, chips, and even things like headache medicine, this little restaurant/shop is a wonderful addition to the Square in downtown HSV. In addition to having just about anything you might find yourself needing while out on a stroll around downtown, or serving jury duty, etc., the staff is incredibly friendly and will (in my experience) go out of their way to ensure your good day.
However, you will be paying convenience store prices for most of their selections: a cup of coffee will only leave you a little better off than a visit to Starbucks (without the carefully constructed flavor--ACoE's coffee has been particularly bitter in my experience, even with sugar and cream), and the food can get a little pricey as well. Packaged foods, on the other hand, seem to be a bit cheaper than, say, the store inside the courthouse but it's not really enough to keep me from driving the little extra distance to the Publix at Twickenham Square.
The cozy atmosphere and neat meeting space upstairs, though, may be enough to counter-balance the slightly higher prices and not-so-awesome coffee--and a warm Spring day sat outside with a cold cup of iced tea and a fresh-made sandwich can't quite be beat.
So all-in-all, if you don't mind spending a bit more and not getting Starbucks-quality coffee, you will get a cozy, unique atmosphere great for a refreshing time on your own or with friends.

name: Super Frivolous
text:
Was soooo good.  Had a rough Friday and came in and asked for a Chocopresso, one shot expresso, one shot chocolate wine, topped with whipped cream and chocolate sauce. Took the edge right off and had served by the sweetest batista.

Would def get again.

resp.text: Thank you so much. Glad you enjoyed the drink. It is yummy.

name: Stephen Beier
text: Great tasting coffee, little over priced. Owner was rude during my visit.

name: Elijah Boyd
text: Quiet little shop with food and convenience items. If you need something when you're downtown try here.

name: davelant
text: A convenient place downtown for a sandwich and a cup of coffee.  (Good Kaffeklatsch-roasted cofee)   Pre-made Happy Tummy sandwiches usually available, as well as sandwiches made to order with chips, yoghurt, fruit and fruit cups for sides.  Good wifi and a lot of room upstairs, including a view over the courthouse square.  Both of the owners have been gracious to me.

name: Adam Evans
text: Terrible attempt at a cappuccino, bright, loud atmosphere, minimal seating.  If all you need is caffeine, it'll do.  For anything else, go elsewhere.

name: Usman Zafar
text: Good coffee , nice place

resp.text: Thanks Usman. Appreciate your visit.

name: Savannah Beier
text: Bad customer service, owner was extremely rude. I will not be going back.

name: Kim Baker
text: We had a grest time.Great customer service. Ice cream and iced coffee, very good.

name: Ashley Brishke
text: Had a birthday party here and the kids and adults both loved it! Super cute place!

resp.text: Awww, thank you!  Parties are our favorites. Thank you for using Pinspiration for such a special time.

name: Thomas H. Moore
text: A place to relax, create and have fun.

name: T MK
text: Its something different and so fun! We had 8 girls with us and we all had a blast and cannot wait to go back.

resp.text: We’re so glad you enjoyed your time. We can’t wait to see you again. 🙂

name: Stay Brite
text: I've been coming here for a while, I've seen a couple of different managers in this shop, but the manager they have now is by far the best they have had. He is friendly and helpful and he makes sure that you're taken care of and know all the details, I came in on 1/8/18 and he gave us the best service we have ever had at a vape shop. We don't know if he will see this but keep up the good work Logan! The shop is very nice and relaxing and they have just about everything you need for vaping as well

name: Mason Walker (BamaHolmes)
text: One of the best Vape shops ever! Ive been to shops all over the country and this is my favorite from the atmosphere to the prices!! 10 outta 10 would recommend

name: Tritium Security
text: Great place! The staff is nice! The manager Logan was very inviting and helpful and extremely nice, the other employee Tj was very nice and knowledgeable as well. The shop is extremely nice and cozy, they have a decent selection of beer and a good selection of juice and vape stuff. I HIGHLY recommend coming to this shop first if you live in Tuscaloosa!

name: Randie Watkins
